titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: Morning at the Presbyterian Church— Heard Mr Fowler from 2. Timothy 4.10. [“]For Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world” My wife dined at her brothers, with Fanny.— P.M. at St. John’s Church. Mr Hawley read the Evening service for the fourth Sunday after the Epiphany—and the Collect for this day “O God, who knowest us to be set in the midst of so many and great dangers, that by reason of the frailty of our nature we cannot always stand upright, grant to us such strength and protection, as may support us in all dangers, and carry us through all temptations, through Jesus Christ our Lord— Amen.”— Mr Hawley’s text was Romans 3.24. [“]Being justified freely by his grace, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus 25. Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God; To declare, I say, at this time his righteousness; that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.”
